title: Jeremy Edwards reveals X Factor: Celebrity cut most brutal remarks
text:
Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards didn’t off to the best start on X Factor: Celebrity (Picture: ITV)

Jeremy Edwards has slammed backlash he received during tonight’s X Factor: Celebrity after his performance with Brendan Cole was brutalised by America’s Got Talent judge Howie Mandel.

Tonight’s episode featured some surprisingly great auditions at Simon Cowell’s lavish Los Angeles mansion – Martin Bashir and The Chase star Jenny Ryan, we’re looking at you – but the only act to get slated was Cole and Edwards, made up of Jeremy and former Strictly Come Dancing professional Brendan.

‘This was just me, I can’t speak for Brendan on this… Brendan is more used to it than I am. They edited down quite a lot of what Howie said and I’m gonna be completely honest with you, I don’t think a lot of it was necessary.

Advertisement

‘That’s all because I don’t mind criticism, and certain things didn’t work but certain things did and there was a lot of positives there, but A, he talked for ages and B, it was negative, negative, negative.’

Brendan was a little softer, adding: ‘Luckily, Nicole and Simon were really nice to us.’

Howie Mandel tore Jeremy and Brendan apart (Picture: NBC Universal)

Jeremy has slammed Howie and gone in (Picture: Getty)

‘And Louis was nice,’ Jeremy agreed. ‘At one point I wanted to say, “dude, you’re not even a judge so can you shut up. It only matters what these three say”.’

Although, the former Holby City actor is taking it all in his stride, kind of.

‘You know what, I was if I’m being completely honest. [Me and Brendan] possibly have the least amount of experience but we are learning at an incredible rate which makes it exciting to see where we’re gonna go,’ he stressed.

‘We didn’t come on the show to be as good as everyone else,’ Brendan added. ‘Next week there is some phenomenal singing on the airways! We didn’t come in to be the best singers, that’s apparent, but all of us have got something about us. That’s why we’ve been in our different careers for so many years.

‘Hopefully that energy will come across on stage should we get the opportunity to go through to the live show.’

The X Factor: Celebrity kicks off tonight at 8.35pm on ITV.
